intro: Hieracium pellucidum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium pellucidum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
